  16. ‌type key = string
  17. ‌type doc = string
  18. ‌type usage_msg = string
  19. ‌type anon_fun = (string -> unit)

  21. ‌type spec =
  22.   | Unit of (unit -> unit)     (* Call the function with unit argument *)
  23.   | Bool of (bool -> unit)     (* Call the function with a bool argument *)
  24.   | Set of bool ref            (* Set the reference to true *)
  25.   | Clear of bool ref          (* Set the reference to false *)
  26.   | String of (string -> unit) (* Call the function with a string argument *)
  27.   | Set_string of string ref   (* Set the reference to the string argument *)
  28.   | Int of (int -> unit)       (* Call the function with an int argument *)
  29.   | Set_int of int ref         (* Set the reference to the int argument *)
  30.   | Float of (float -> unit)   (* Call the function with a float argument *)
  31.   | Set_float of float ref     (* Set the reference to the float argument *)
  32.   | Tuple of spec list         (* Take several arguments according to the
  33.                                   spec list *)
  34.   | Symbol of string list * (string -> unit)
  35.                                (* Take one of the symbols as argument and
  36.                                   call the function with the symbol. *)
  37.   | Rest of (string -> unit)   (* Stop interpreting keywords and call the
  38.                                   function with each remaining argument *)
  39.   | Rest_all of (string list -> unit)
  40.                                (* Stop interpreting keywords and call the
  41.                                   function with all remaining arguments. *)
  42.   | Expand of (string -> string array) (* If the remaining arguments to process
  43.                                           are of the form
  44.                                           [["-foo"; "arg"] @ rest] where "foo"
  45.                                           is registered as [Expand f], then the
  46.                                           arguments [f "arg" @ rest] are
  47.                                           processed. Only allowed in
  48.                                           [parse_and_expand_argv_dynamic]. *)

  50. exception Bad of string
  51. exception Help of string

  53. ‌type error =
  54.   | Unknown of string
  55.   | Wrong of string * string * string  (* option, actual, expected *)
  56.   | Missing of string
  57.   | Message of string

  59. exception Stop of error (* used internally *)

  61. open Printf

  63. ‌let rec assoc3 x l =
  64.   match l with
  65.   | [] -> raise Not_found
  66.   | (y1, y2, _) :: _ when y1 = x -> y2
  67.   | _ :: t -> assoc3 x t


  70. ‌let split s =
  71.   let i = String.index s '=' in
  72.   let len = String.length s in
  73.   String.sub s 0 i, String.sub s (i+1) (len-(i+1))


  76. ‌let make_symlist prefix sep suffix l =
  77.   match l with
  78.   | [] -> "<none>"
  79.   | h::t -> (List.fold_left (fun x y -> x ^ sep ^ y) (prefix ^ h) t) ^ suffix


  82. let print_spec buf (key, spec, doc) =
  83.   if String.length doc > 0 then
  84.     match spec with
  85.     | Symbol (l, _) ->
  86.         bprintf buf "  %s %s%s\n" key (make_symlist "{" "|" "}" l) doc
  87.     | _ ->
  88.         bprintf buf "  %s %s\n" key doc


  91. ‌let help_action () = raise (Stop (Unknown "-help"))

  93. ‌let add_help speclist =
  94.   let add1 =
  95.     try ignore (assoc3 "-help" speclist); []
  96.     with Not_found ->
  97.             ["-help", Unit help_action, " Display this list of options"]
  98.   and add2 =
  99.     try ignore (assoc3 "--help" speclist); []
  100.     with Not_found ->
  101.             ["--help", Unit help_action, " Display this list of options"]
  102.   in
  103.   speclist @ (add1 @ add2)


  106. ‌let usage_b buf speclist errmsg =
  107.   bprintf buf "%s\n" errmsg;
  108.   List.iter (print_spec buf) (add_help speclist)


  111. ‌let usage_string speclist errmsg =
  112.   let b = Buffer.create 200 in
  113.   usage_b b speclist errmsg;
  114.   Buffer.contents b


  117. ‌let usage speclist errmsg =
  118.   eprintf "%s" (usage_string speclist errmsg)


  121. ‌let current = ref 0

  123. ‌let bool_of_string_opt x =
  124.   try Some (bool_of_string x)
  125.   with Invalid_argument _ -> None

  127. ‌let int_of_string_opt x =
  128.   try Some (int_of_string x)
  129.   with Failure _ -> None

  131. ‌let float_of_string_opt x =
  132.   try Some (float_of_string x)
  133.   with Failure _ -> None

  135. ‌let parse_and_expand_argv_dynamic_aux allow_expand current argv speclist anonfun
  136.                                       errmsg =
  137.   let initpos = !current in
  138.   let convert_error error =
  139.     (* convert an internal error to a Bad/Help exception
  140.        *or* add the program name as a prefix and the usage message as a suffix
  141.        to an user-raised Bad exception.
  142.     *)
  143.     let b = Buffer.create 200 in
  144.     let progname =
  145.       if initpos < (Array.length !argv) then !argv.(initpos) else "(?)" in
  146.     begin match error with
  147.       | Unknown "-help" -> ()
  148.       | Unknown "--help" -> ()
  149.       | Unknown s ->
  150.           bprintf b "%s: unknown option '%s'.\n" progname s
  151.       | Missing s ->
  152.           bprintf b "%s: option '%s' needs an argument.\n" progname s
  153.       | Wrong (opt, arg, expected) ->
  154.           bprintf b "%s: wrong argument '%s'; option '%s' expects %s.\n"
  155.                   progname arg opt expected
  156.       | Message s -> (* user error message *)
  157.           bprintf b "%s: %s.\n" progname s
  158.     end;
  159.     usage_b b !speclist errmsg;
  160.     if error = Unknown "-help" || error = Unknown "--help"
  161.     then Help (Buffer.contents b)
  162.     else Bad (Buffer.contents b)
  163.   in
  164.   incr current;
  165.   while !current < (Array.length !argv) do
  166.     begin try
  167. ‌      let s = !argv.(!current) in
  168.       if String.starts_with ~prefix:"-" s then begin
  169. ‌        let action, follow =
  170.           try assoc3 s !speclist, None
  171.           with Not_found ->
  172.           try
  173.             let keyword, arg = split s in
  174.             assoc3 keyword !speclist, Some arg
  175.           with Not_found -> raise (Stop (Unknown s))
  176.         in
  177. ‌        let no_arg () =
  178.           match follow with
  179.           | None -> ()
  180.           | Some arg -> raise (Stop (Wrong (s, arg, "no argument"))) in
  181. ‌        let get_arg () =
  182.           match follow with
  183.           | None ->
  184.               if !current + 1 < (Array.length !argv) then !argv.(!current + 1)
  185.               else raise (Stop (Missing s))
  186.           | Some arg -> arg
  187.         in
  188. ‌        let consume_arg () =
  189.           match follow with
  190.           | None -> incr current
  191.           | Some _ -> ()
  192.         in
  193. ‌        let rec treat_action = function
  194.         | Unit f -> no_arg (); f ();
  195.         | Bool f ->
  196.             let arg = get_arg () in
  197.             begin match bool_of_string_opt arg with
  198.             | None -> raise (Stop (Wrong (s, arg, "a boolean")))
  199.             | Some s -> f s
  200.             end;
  201.             consume_arg ();
  202.         | Set r -> no_arg (); r := true;
  203.         | Clear r -> no_arg (); r := false;
  204.         | String f ->
  205.             let arg = get_arg () in
  206.             f arg;
  207.             consume_arg ();
  208.         | Symbol (symb, f) ->
  209.             let arg = get_arg () in
  210.             if List.mem arg symb then begin
  211.               f arg;
  212.               consume_arg ();
  213.             end else begin
  214.               raise (Stop (Wrong (s, arg, "one of: "
  215.                                           ^ (make_symlist "" " " "" symb))))
  216.             end
  217.         | Set_string r ->
  218.             r := get_arg ();
  219.             consume_arg ();
  220.         | Int f ->
  221. ‌            let arg = get_arg () in
  222.             begin match int_of_string_opt arg with
  223.             | None -> raise (Stop (Wrong (s, arg, "an integer")))
  224.             | Some x -> f x
  225.             end;
  226.             consume_arg ();
  227.         | Set_int r ->
  228. ‌            let arg = get_arg () in
  229.             begin match int_of_string_opt arg with
  230.             | None -> raise (Stop (Wrong (s, arg, "an integer")))
  231.             | Some x -> r := x
  232.             end;
  233.             consume_arg ();
  234.         | Float f ->
  235. ‌            let arg = get_arg () in
  236.             begin match float_of_string_opt arg with
  237.             | None -> raise (Stop (Wrong (s, arg, "a float")))
  238.             | Some x -> f x
  239.             end;
  240.             consume_arg ();
  241.         | Set_float r ->
  242. ‌            let arg = get_arg () in
  243.             begin match float_of_string_opt arg with
  244.             | None -> raise (Stop (Wrong (s, arg, "a float")))
  245.             | Some x -> r := x
  246.             end;
  247.             consume_arg ();
  248.         | Tuple specs ->
  249.             no_arg ();
  250.             List.iter treat_action specs;
  251.         | Rest f ->
  252.             no_arg ();
  253.             while !current < (Array.length !argv) - 1 do
  254.               f !argv.(!current + 1);
  255.               consume_arg ();
  256.             done;
  257.         | Rest_all f ->
  258.             no_arg ();
  259. ‌            let acc = ref [] in
  260.             while !current < Array.length !argv - 1 do
  261.               acc := !argv.(!current + 1) :: !acc;
  262.               consume_arg ();
  263.             done;
  264.             f (List.rev !acc)
  265.         | Expand f ->
  266.             if not allow_expand then
  267.               raise (Invalid_argument "Arg.Expand is is only allowed with \
  268.                                        Arg.parse_and_expand_argv_dynamic");
  269. ‌            let arg = get_arg () in
  270. ‌            let newarg = f arg in
  271.             consume_arg ();
  272. ‌            let before = Array.sub !argv 0 (!current + 1)
  273.             and after =
  274.               Array.sub !argv (!current + 1)
  275.                         ((Array.length !argv) - !current - 1) in
  276.             argv:= Array.concat [before;newarg;after];
  277.         in
  278.         treat_action action end
  279.       else anonfun s
  280.     with | Bad m -> raise (convert_error (Message m));
  281.          | Stop e -> raise (convert_error e);
  282.     end;
  283.     incr current
  284.   done

  286. ‌let parse_and_expand_argv_dynamic current argv speclist anonfun errmsg =
  287.   parse_and_expand_argv_dynamic_aux true current argv speclist anonfun errmsg

  289. ‌let parse_argv_dynamic ?(current=current) argv speclist anonfun errmsg =
  290.   parse_and_expand_argv_dynamic_aux false current (ref argv) speclist anonfun
  291.     errmsg


  294. ‌let parse_argv ?(current=current) argv speclist anonfun errmsg =
  295.   parse_argv_dynamic ~current:current argv (ref speclist) anonfun errmsg


  298. ‌let parse l f msg =
  299.   try
  300.     parse_argv Sys.argv l f msg
  301.   with
  302.   | Bad msg -> eprintf "%s" msg; exit 2
  303.   | Help msg -> printf "%s" msg; exit 0


  306. ‌let parse_dynamic l f msg =
  307.   try
  308.     parse_argv_dynamic Sys.argv l f msg
  309.   with
  310.   | Bad msg -> eprintf "%s" msg; exit 2
  311.   | Help msg -> printf "%s" msg; exit 0

  313. ‌let parse_expand l f msg =
  314.   try
  315.     let argv = ref Sys.argv in
  316.     let spec = ref l in
  317.     let current = ref (!current) in
  318.     parse_and_expand_argv_dynamic current argv spec f msg
  319.   with
  320.   | Bad msg -> eprintf "%s" msg; exit 2
  321.   | Help msg -> printf "%s" msg; exit 0


  324. ‌let second_word s =
  325.   let len = String.length s in
  326.   let rec loop n =
  327.     if n >= len then len
  328.     else if s.[n] = ' ' then loop (n+1)
  329.     else n
  330.   in
  331.   match String.index s '\t' with
  332.   | n -> loop (n+1)
  333.   | exception Not_found ->
  334.       begin match String.index s ' ' with
  335.       | n -> loop (n+1)
  336.       | exception Not_found -> len
  337.       end


  340. ‌let max_arg_len cur (kwd, spec, doc) =
  341.   match spec with
  342.   | Symbol _ -> Int.max cur (String.length kwd)
  343.   | _ -> Int.max cur (String.length kwd + second_word doc)


  346. ‌let replace_leading_tab s =
  347.   let seen = ref false in
  348.   String.map (function '\t' when not !seen -> seen := true; ' ' | c -> c) s

  350. let add_padding len ksd =
  351.   match ksd with
  352.   | (_, _, "") ->
  353.       (* Do not pad undocumented options, so that they still don't show up when
  354.        * run through [usage] or [parse]. *)
  355.       ksd
  356.   | (kwd, (Symbol _ as spec), msg) ->
  357.       let cutcol = second_word msg in
  358.       let spaces = String.make ((Int.max 0 (len - cutcol)) + 3) ' ' in
  359.       (kwd, spec, "\n" ^ spaces ^ replace_leading_tab msg)
  360.   | (kwd, spec, msg) ->
  361.       let cutcol = second_word msg in
  362.       let kwd_len = String.length kwd in
  363.       let diff = len - kwd_len - cutcol in
  364.       if diff <= 0 then
  365.         (kwd, spec, replace_leading_tab msg)
  366.       else
  367.         let spaces = String.make diff ' ' in
  368.         let prefix = String.sub (replace_leading_tab msg) 0 cutcol in
  369.         let suffix = String.sub msg cutcol (String.length msg - cutcol) in
  370.         (kwd, spec, prefix ^ spaces ^ suffix)


  373. ‌let align ?(limit=max_int) speclist =
  374.   let completed = add_help speclist in
  375.   let len = List.fold_left max_arg_len 0 completed in
  376.   let len = Int.min len limit in
  377.   List.map (add_padding len) completed

  379. ‌let trim_cr s =
  380.   let len = String.length s in
  381.   if len > 0 && String.get s (len - 1) = '\r' then
  382.     String.sub s 0 (len - 1)
  383.   else
  384.     s

  386. ‌let read_aux trim sep file =
  387.   let ic = open_in_bin file in
  388.   let buf = Buffer.create 200 in
  389.   let words = ref [] in
  390.   let stash () =
  391.     let word = Buffer.contents buf in
  392.     let word = if trim then trim_cr word else word in
  393.     words := word :: !words;
  394.     Buffer.clear buf
  395.   in
  396.   begin
  397.     try while true do
  398. ‌        let c = input_char ic in
  399.         if c = sep then stash () else Buffer.add_char buf c
  400.       done
  401.     with End_of_file -> ()
  402.   end;
  403.   if Buffer.length buf > 0 then stash ();
  404.   close_in ic;
  405.   Array.of_list (List.rev !words)

  407. ‌let read_arg = read_aux true '\n'

  409. ‌let read_arg0 = read_aux false '\x00'

  411. ‌let write_aux sep file args =
  412.   let oc = open_out_bin file in
  413.   Array.iter (fun s -> fprintf oc "%s%c" s sep) args;
  414.   close_out oc

  416. let write_arg = write_aux '\n'

  418. let write_arg0 = write_aux '\x00'
